image.altText: Smoke rises across a skyline and houses after a military strike

props.synopsis: Hamas says it has accepted a ceasefire proposal from Egypt and Qatar, but Israel says the deal the group has agreed to is "far from" its "necessary requirements".

title.children: Hamas accepts ceasefire proposal in Gaza war, Israel says deal 'far from' its demands

image.altText: A soldier mans a gun atop a tank that flies the Israeli flag in the desert

props.synopsis: The Israel Defense Forces are conducting strikes against Hamas targets in Rafah, hours after the militant group said it would agree to a ceasefire deal. Follow live.

title.children: Israel strikes targets in Rafah after Hamas said it would accept ceasefire deal

image.altText: A concept design for an AFL stadium at Macquarie Point.

props.synopsis: Labor has changed its stance on the proposed stadium for Hobart's Macquarie Point, with new leader Dean Winter throwing his support behind it. It will give the minority Liberal government the numbers it needs to get the proposal through the parliament's lower house, but why has the change come now?

title.children: Labor and the Liberals align on a waterfront stadium for Hobart, but is it the end of the AFL's political problems?

image.altText: A crowd of people walking in a city with high rise buildings in the background on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: After near-unanimous calls for multiple interest rate cuts a few months ago, economists now think more hikes are on the cards. But even though inflation is proving difficult to contain, increasing rates further still may not be the answer.

title.children: Evidence tells us that we're only spending on necessities, so why are the experts advocating for more rate hikes?

image.altText: A person in scuba diving gear holds a red handfish in a water-filled plastic bag

props.synopsis: They've been gently coaxed out of the plastic bag and into the big, bad underwater world where they are exposed to the elements. Now, researchers have big hopes this small group of red handfish will not only survive, but thrive — the species is depending on it.

title.children: Rescue mission for critically endangered red handfish deemed a success as a fifth of population returned to open water

image.altText: A woman seated alone in classroom with her hands clasped on a table, looking into the camera.

props.synopsis: School teacher Georgina Routley says more needs to be done to reduce the HECS debts of women and people who leave the workforce for a period of time.

title.children: 'Waiting with bated breath': $3 billion HECS relief welcomed but debtors hope for more in budget

image.altText: A helicopter flying in the air at sunset.

props.synopsis: A Chinese military jet has detonated flares near an Australian Navy helicopter which was operating in international waters, forcing the pilot to take evasive action to avoid an accident.

title.children: Australian helicopter forced to take evasive action after Chinese fighter detonates flares

image.altText: Composite thumb Dean Winter, Hobart stadium.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian Labor announces it will support the proposed Macquarie Point AFL stadium in Hobart, all but assuring it will pass parliament.

title.children: Hobart AFL stadium at Macquarie Point a near certainty as Labor lends its support

image.altText: Donald Trump sits in court in a suit and red tie looking at the camera

props.synopsis: The judge overseeing Donald Trump's criminal trial said he would hold the former president in contempt of court for a tenth time for violating a gag order and said he would consider jailing him for further violations.

title.children: 'Truly the last resort': Judge warns of jail time for Donald Trump after tenth gag order breach

image.altText: William Venneste is looking for a new flatmate he is sitting on a bed inside an apartment in lane cove

props.synopsis: Like many temporary students and workers, finding an affordable place to stay during William Vanneste's three-month long internship in Sydney was harder than he expected.

title.children: $300 to share a bed with a stranger: How Sydney's rental crisis is squeezing temporary residents

image.altText: A man speaks into a microphone

props.synopsis: Netflix's adaptation of Chinese sci-fi novel The Three-Body Problem is just one chapter of the series' challenging journey to the West. The books appear to tell a China story that Beijing is hesitant to share with the world — especially when it also involves a murder.

title.children: A billionaire convinced Netflix to invest in a Chinese sci-fi series. Then he was murdered

image.altText: Prison inmate behind bars

props.synopsis: In the current firestorm of recriminations about the causes of domestic violence and how we might address it, there have been calls for the more frequent or more rapid jailing of violent men. But few are asking: what happens then?

title.children: If 'jailing is failing', why are we still sending violent offenders to prison and expecting things will change?

image.altText: Three white people smiling at camera

props.synopsis: Andrew Jenner says the deal he and fellow Jacqui Lambie Network MPs signed to help the Tasmanian Liberals form government "wasn't the best", but his two colleagues have defended it.

title.children: 'It wasn't the best': Jacqui Lambie Network MP has regrets about deal signed with Tasmanian Liberals

image.altText: A young man in a blue shirt standing in a field. There is a horse in the background.

props.synopsis: After finding anecdotal success with low doses of naltrexone, Griffith University researchers will undertake clinical trials involving the drug and a placebo to see its effect on long COVID sufferers.

title.children: Jayden took a drug designed for substance abusers after developing long COVID

image.altText: The Q+A panel discuss the current university encampments and an imminent ground invasion of Rafah.

props.synopsis: Both sides of politics show concern over hate speech on Q+A, but the government's Tony Burke says pro-Palestine encampments at universities should be left alone if they are peaceful.

title.children: Frontbencher Tony Burke backs right of pro-Palestinian university protests amid warnings of Jewish hate

image.altText: A front-on view of a hammerhead shark

props.synopsis: Many Australians prefer to be as far from a shark as possible, but scientists are concerned that some people are getting too close to critically endangered species.

title.children: Swimming with baby hammerhead sharks should be a no-go, scientists say

image.altText: Police block roads on a deserted street at night

props.synopsis: Premier Roger Cook says a letter was sent to WA's education minister with concerns about the behaviour of the teen, who was a student at Rossmoyne Senior High School, where parents are expressing shock about the incident.

title.children: 'I have no words': Parents express shock after Perth high school student is shot dead by police

image.altText: A mum with two smiley girls on her lap

props.synopsis: Parents of children born during the COVID-19 pandemic are being urged to get their children flu shots, with almost 5,000 cases in children aged zero to four so far this year.

title.children: 'They don't have any natural protection': Children born during COVID pandemic urged to get flu vaccine

image.altText: A tank with an Israeli flag on it, driving on a dirt road

props.synopsis: Israel told Palestinians to move from Rafah, signalling a ground invasion was imminent. Twelve hours later, Hamas agreed to a ceasefire proposal. So does Israel intend to launch a Rafah attack, or was it a ploy to strongarm Hamas?

title.children: Netanyahu has promised another invasion. It could be a high-stakes bargaining chip

image.altText: A family of eight bundled up on a cart pulled by a donkey

props.synopsis: Israel's armed forces have begun evacuating civilians from Gaza's southernmost city as an invasion by the IDF looms.

title.children: Penny Wong warns Israel 'should not go down this path' as civilians told to evacuate Rafah

image.altText: A tank fires between two trees

props.synopsis: The Russian Defense Ministry announced the plans saying they would be in response to "provocative statements" from Western officials in recent weeks.

title.children: Russia announces nuclear weapons drills in response to Western 'provocative statements'

image.altText: Police in Queensland use wanding to search for knives

props.synopsis: Police in New South Wales will be able to "wand" anyone in designated areas for a weapon, under state government proposals to combat knife crime.

title.children: NSW police set to get 'wanding' powers in wake of Sydney stabbing attacks

image.altText: Anthony Edwards celebrates a basket

props.synopsis: A new generation of superstars have begun to take over the NBA, and Anthony Edwards is leading the pack all while being compared to the greatest of all time. It's one of five things we learnt from the first round of the playoffs.

title.children: The new face of the NBA is here, and he's reminding fans of Michael Jordan

image.altText: Callum and Jake smiling and holding a dog.

props.synopsis: Mexican authorities say they believe two Australian tourists and their American friend were shot dead by thieves who were trying to steal their car for its tyres.

title.children: 'Wanted to steal their tyres': Aussie brothers confirmed dead in what Mexican police say was botched robbery

image.altText: A female boxer from Papua New Guinea is wearing a pink polo shirt, has her fists raised, and is staring at the camera.

props.synopsis: Papua New Guinea's Petronela Nokenoke started boxing for fun. She's now one of the best boxers in the country and wants to be a role model for others in her community.

title.children: Petronela Nokenoke is leading the way for female boxers in Papua New Guinea

image.altText: Anthony Albanese distances his government from Community Protection Board

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese used to get frustrated at questions he felt should have been asked of the government of the day. Now in government, the prime minster appears frustrated when asked questions about decisions his government has made.

title.children: Albanese is eager to blame anyone but his government. The Westminster system doesn't work like that

image.altText: Yarra Valley Grammar School sign

props.synopsis: Three male students at Yarra Valley Grammar are suspended after staff discovered a spreadsheet where the students used highly offensive terms to rate female pupils.

title.children: 'Shocked and outraged': Melbourne private school says it's contacted police over ranking of female students

image.altText: A composite image of three men, all looking at the camera.

props.synopsis: Russia's policy of encouraging convicts to bolster its invasion of Ukraine was simple — survive six months and get your freedom. Some returned to the communities they once terrorised, only to commit new crimes.

title.children: Putin told killers and cannibals to 'atone for their crime on the battlefield'. It didn't end well

image.altText: A photo of a man in a white tux

props.synopsis: The Australian actor won a silver Logie for his role as Sergeant Frank Gilroy in popular 1980s soap A Country Practice.

title.children: Brian Wenzel, best known for role in A Country Practice, dies aged 94

image.altText: Two photos of two men with dark hair and bears, wearing high necked tops and standing in front of white backdrops.

props.synopsis: Detectives say they are searching for brothers Abhijeet Abhijeet and Robin Gartan who fled a violent dispute that left one man dead and another injured in Ormond on Sunday.

title.children: Police search for two brothers after fatal stabbing in Melbourne's south-east

image.altText: koala pic thumbnail

props.synopsis: They have a reputation for being lazy and sleeping all day, but this koala made a surprise entry in this year's Ironman Australia triathlon at Port Macquarie.

title.children: Koala 'on a mission' surprises athletes in Ironman Australia triathlon

image.altText: County Court judge Geoff Chettle.

props.synopsis: A Victorian judge has been reprimanded for using "demeaning" and "gratuitous" language towards a woman at the centre of a sexual assault trial.

title.children: Victorian judge 'lacked sensitivity' towards alleged sexual assault victim, judicial watchdog finds

image.altText: A woman pulls a sheep out of a race, ready to shear.

props.synopsis: The 31-year-old NSW shearer has set the first Australian women's merino shearing record for the most ewes shorn in an eight-hour period.

title.children: Ewe beauty: Trailblazing Jeanine Kimm shears her way to an Australian record

image.altText: David McBride looks into the camera in a tight closeup portrait. He is wearing glasses and stands in a dark room.

props.synopsis: Prosecutors are calling for former military lawyer David McBride to be jailed for stealing and unlawfully sharing classified material. McBride's lawyers are urging the court to find his motivation for sharing the material with journalists to be honourable.

title.children: 'He honestly believed he was not committing an offence': David McBride faces sentencing for sharing classified documents

image.altText: Composite of rappers Drake and Kendrick Lamar

props.synopsis: The war of words between hip hop's two biggest stars has taken a nasty turn with allegations of domestic violence, secret children, paedophilia and more.

title.children: Drake responds to Kendrick Lamar's 'paedophile' allegations as nasty rap feud escalates
